articles.title: Fit for a prince: Denmark's Axelsen takes badminton gold - and royal call - CNA
articles.description: Denmark's Viktor Axelsen received royal approval after winning badminton gold on Monday (Aug 2) to break Asia's stranglehold, then warned he intends to reign over the sport for some time to come.
articles.content: TOKYO: Denmark's Viktor Axelsen received royal approval after winning badminton gold on Monday (Aug 2) to break Asia's stranglehold, then warned he intends to reign over the sport for some time to co… [+3669 chars]

articles.author: The Star Online
articles.title: Thai baht and Malaysian ringgit weaken as Covid-19 virus pandemic issues keep on rising - The Star Online
articles.description: Thailand's baht was on track for its worst session in two weeks on Monday, while Malaysia's ringgit was set to see its worst day in more than a week, as the two South-East Asian countries continued to battle a surge in coronavirus cases.
articles.content: BANGKOK Aug 2 (Reuters): Thailand's baht was on track for its worst session in two weeks on Monday, while Malaysia's ringgit was set to see its worst day in more than a week, as the two South-East As… [+2017 chars]

articles.author: The Star Online
articles.title: Asia's factories reflect North-South divide as Delta spreads - The Star Online
articles.description: MANILA (Bloomberg) -- Manufacturing managers in Southeast Asia saw a slump in activity as the region grapples with one of the world’s worst Covid-19 outbreaks, while North Asia continued to see a pick up as the global economy recovers.

articles.title: Indonesia urges Myanmar to approve appointment of ASEAN envoy - CNA
articles.description: JAKARTA: Indonesia's foreign minister urged Myanmar on Monday (Aug 2) to approve the appointment of an Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN) special envoy and said little progress had been made on a plan to promote talks between Myanmar's rival sides.

articles.title: Cambodia to mix vaccines as booster shots to fight COVID - The Star Online
articles.description: PHNOM PENH (Reuters) -     Cambodia will begin offering a booster shot against Covid-19, switching between the AstraZeneca and Chinese COVID-19 vaccines  in an effort to fight the spread of the coronavirus in the Southeast Asian country.
